meanings.definition: To extend out, over, or beyond something else
meanings.sent1: The tree branches jut out from the trunk.
meanings.sent2: The cliff juts into the sea, creating a dramatic view.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel tried to jut its head through the fence but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed made her jut out from the rest of the team.
meanings.sent5: The skyscraper's spire juts into the sky like a needle.

meanings.sent1: The rocky jut provided a perfect spot for fishing.
meanings.sent2: The jut of the mountain peak was visible from afar.
meanings.sent3: The jut on the sculpture's nose made it look comical.
meanings.sent4: The jut of the peninsula resembled a giant's finger pointing towards the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The jut of the cliff cast a shadow over the beach below.
